summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services clinical encounter form documenting a medical assessment of an inmate on August 16, 2019, shortly after the inmate was found with a weapon. The inmate, whose name is redacted, reported no injury or pain and was scheduled for a psychological evaluation.

persons.name: Provider
persons.context: The medical professional who conducted the clinical encounter and assessment of the inmate.

events.title: Inmate Found with Weapon and Medical Assessment
events.description: An inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York) was found with a weapon and subsequently underwent a medical assessment where they reported no injury or pain.

locations: Bureau of Prisons - NYM (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
11 North (specific location within the facility where the incident occurred)
keyFacts: The document is a medical encounter form dated August 16, 2019, from the Bureau of Prisons.
The inmate reported the cause of injury as 'I got caught with a weapon on me' but stated 'I have no injury' and reported no pain.
The inmate was calm, noncombative, and oriented during the exam, with vital signs recorded.
The medical plan included a follow-up as needed and noted the inmate was about to be seen by Psychology for a psychological evaluation.
The inmate's name, date of birth, sex, and race are redacted in the document.
